title: This Film May Save Your Life
content: For those of you who may have missed it at Typophile Film Festival #1, drop everything and go watch [Cheshire Dave’s](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Cheshire%20Dave) [Etched in Stone](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329203138/http:/www.veer.com/ideas/etched/), a journey through the seedy underworld of Hollywood poster design. Our generous pals at [Veer](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Veer) have been so kind as to host it for Chesh - the only question we ask is: Who gets to keep the Oscar?
author: Jared Benson : 3 August, 2005 - 3:25pm

comments.content: Chesh can have the Oscar. My mantle is already full of Emmy. (Really.)
Many thanks for the link and the kind response. As for the Oscar, I thought we were going to have joint Calgary — er, custody.

haha great! now i know why…

by the way, dont mean to spoil the thread, but can anybody tell me what font the poster for ‘stay cool’ is set in (about 1/3 in the movie)? been after it for a while now!  
if its coded within the title or something, then its probably late and im tired : )

thanks,  
monika

It’s [Gothic 821](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329203138/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=821) with snow added in Illustrator. I tried going to one of the snowy fonts, but not even the commercial ones looked decent.

great, thanks!  
i was after the font, not the effect, so that works : )

thinking about it, a really far fetched connection would have been to use a retro refrigerator font like [magneto](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329203138/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/magneto/)

…

…naah

It was brilliant, audacious and wacky all in one short.

Brilliant in the sense that one could create a mystery storyline around the overuse of a typeface ( [Trajan](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Trajan) at that) and pull in a reference to Nero without getting too cerebral?

Audacious in the daring use of a capital T, surrounded by flaming columns. [Rob Cohen](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329203138/http:/www.imdb.com/title/tt0295701/?fr=c2l0ZT1kZnxteD0yMHxsbT01MDB8dHQ9MXxmYj11fHBuPTB8cT10cmlwbGUgeHxodG1sPTF8bm09MQ__;fc=1;ft=21;fm=1) eat your heart out.

Wacky as in _the-calling-card-of-the-villain-is-a-chisel_ wacky and _the-characters-die-from-using-the-wrong-font_ wacky.

My favorite part is how clicking your mouse spastically will automatically bring up images of Trajan’s column.

And then of course, the fire. I kept thinking.. The Great T Has Spoken!

Apart from liking the general storyline, and, yes, OD’ing on Trajan, I fell seriously in love with the white on black credits. Want that font. _Badly_. What is it?

Digged the soundtrack as well.

My work is a game. A very serious game [M.C. Escher]

I felt like Chrismas came early. Thanks!
